newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Alumina carrier runs aground at Fremantle.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Alumina carrier runs aground at Fremantle.

text.p: A bulk carrier with a cargo of alumina ran aground in a channel while leaving the port of Fremantle, Western Australia, on Friday after suffering a steerage problem, a Fremantle Port Authority spokeswoman said.

The 50,000-dwt Tassos N, bound for the United States, was floated off by tugs shortly after midday local time (0400 GMT) and was towed to a safe anchorage in Cockburn Sound in the Fremantle outer harbour, the spokeswoman said. "An investigation of the incident will take place before the ship can sail on," she said. The ship was carrying 38,775 tonnes of alumina loaded at the Alcoa alumina terminal.
